key_title: Key to the genera of Lycopodiaceae

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the families of ferns and allied plants

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta)
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1994). Ferns and allied plants (Psilophyta, Lycopodiophyta, Polypodiophyta). In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves not fleshy, overlapping on long stem

Leaves more than 6 mm long and more than 1 mm wide; plants more or less tufted, lacking branched rhizome or creeping stem; sporophylls similar to vegetative leaves, equal or smaller in size, persistent; branches often growing on beyond fertile part

Leaves less than 6 mm long and/or less than 1 mm wide; plants with branched rhizome or creeping stem, aerial stems or branches not or rarely tufted; sporophylls strongly modified and ephemeral; strobili terminating main or lateral blanches
Sporophylls similar to foliage leaves, often bearing bulbils in axils, sporangia spread along the stem; leaves less than 9 mm long
Sporophylls usually smaller than foliage leaves, never bearing bulbils, 4-ranked, terminal; foliage leaves more than 9 mm long
Erect stems unbranched or sometimes once or twice branched; strobili lateral, or terminal on erect unbranched stem arising from a prostrate main stem
Erect stems branching more than twice; strobili terminating branchlets
